message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CL 

This paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) category as it focuses on improving the performance of CNNs on image classification and action recognition tasks. Additionally, the paper proposes a novel convolutional layer that modifies the weights of convolutional layers adaptively under the guidance of global context, which is a common technique used in computer vision. 

The paper also involves machine learning techniques, which suggests that it could belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) category. 

The proposed Context-Gated Convolution (CGC) is designed to extract local patterns and compose discriminative features, which is a common goal in Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) research. 

The paper also involves neural networks, which suggests that it could belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) category. 

Finally, the paper involves natural language processing techniques, which suggests that it could belong to the Computation and Language (cs.CL) category.
